body: Did you verify across various versions of Weld?
Yes, tested against 1.1.19.Final, 2.0.5.Final, 2.2.0.Beta1 and 2.2.0.Beta2. All builds successful.
Merge manually
I'm good with this proposed approach.

Ron,

I had a problem with the following files:
- deltaspike/core/api/src/main/java/org/apache/deltaspike/core/api/config/ConfigResolver.java:298: Line is longer than 120 characters.
- deltaspike/core/api/src/main/java/org/apache/deltaspike/core/api/exception/control/BeforeHandles.java:34: Line is longer than 120 characters.
- deltaspike/core/api/src/main/java/org/apache/deltaspike/core/api/exception/control/BeforeHandles.java:45: Line is longer than 120 characters.

Can you check it please running mvn clean install -Prat ?

Maybe you can also work on new JDK 1.8 javadoc validation (not mandatory). When running mvn javadoc:javadoc with JDK 1.8, the build fails.

I fixed the warnings and amended the commit. 

I tried running the javadoc goal on JDK8, but it doesn't fail, just shows warnings.
IMHO, checking the javadoc for doclint compatibility should be a separate task.
PR merged
Out of date, I'll create a new pull request.
Merged
Merged

After all, all that's needed to make Weld 3 work is to remove explicit weld-core dependency. All the necessary dependencies for any given release (1.x, 2.x, 3.x) are pulled in through weld-core-bom depchain in Weld profile's dependencyManagement.
Should not be merged just yet, most likely this will be soon fixed in Weld.
PR merged
This was updated and should be ok. I also added corresponding jacoco property to obtain complete coverage information.
PR merged

I can see one of the above issues has been resolved in the meantime, I can try rebasing the PR and running the tests.
Anyway apart from Weld 1, all other versions should work. I will take a closer look at it on Monday and let you know.
I can confirm that Weld2 and Weld3 are working. I rebased the code with master to try your PR but Weld1 still failing.
Then I shall take a closer look at it on Monday :-)

Thanks @manovotn .

PR merged and document published at: http://deltaspike.apache.org/documentation/build.html

To sum this up:
- Removes the need to use system property to trigger Weld profiles 
- Removes the common profile for all Weld profiles, deps/setups were copied over to relevant profiles (turns out to be the smoothest solution)
- Introduces default values for Weld profiles
- So a simple `mvn clean verify -PWeld${X}` (where X = 1 || 2 || 3) will work
- You can still specify Weld version with `-Dweld.version=...`; obviously the major release version has to match the chosen profile
Looks good to me.  If no one else gets to it, I'll merge this evening (EDT).  Thanks for the contrib!

Hi Danny,

Just ran your changes against wildfly 10.  Its failing for:

```
Tests in error: 
  should_query_names(org.apache.deltaspike.data.impl.handler.EntityRepositoryHandlerTest): org.hibernate.MappingException: Unknown entity: java.lang.String
```

I think this is the difference between the original patch and the new changes.  I think the spec expects the class passed in to be an entity for a typed query.  By not using a typed query, it uses fallback logic to plain JDBC column mapping.

Also, please rebase your changes from our master.  Finally, please take a look at our contribution guide, specifically our code formatting.  http://deltaspike.apache.org/documentation/source.html

Thanks!

ah ok, I think one can check if the return type is a registered entity type with the entitymanager.
I will try this tomorrow.

Hi,

I think everything should be fine now with the code (tested it on wildfly 10 & used eclipse formatter).

A quick question about constributing. Should I upload a patch file to Jira or can you merge the changes directly from GitHub to the ASF repository?
Done, didn't notice that this was such recent code
Also, regarding your question, I'm fine with pulling the branch from GH into our repo.

Both TomEE 7 and Wildfly 10 fail on this test:

TomEE:

```
should_query_names(org.apache.deltaspike.data.impl.handler.EntityRepositoryHandlerTest): Column not found: 0
```

Wildfly:

```
should_query_names(org.apache.deltaspike.data.impl.handler.EntityRepositoryHandlerTest): org.hibernate.exception.SQLGrammarException: could not execute query
```

In addition, I had to fix a CS issue:

```
-    QueryHint[] hints() default {};
+    QueryHint[] hints() default { };
```

Hi,

I removed some formatting changes I commited from code I didn't touch. I also finally removed the  now unused Query paramter (forgot that).

On the point of failed tests. I'm sorry, but I can't reproduce them. I have run the following builds in './deltaspike/modules/data/impl':
- mvn clean test -P wildfly-build-managed -Dwildfly.version=10.0.0.Final
- mvn clean test -P tomee7-build-managed

and both are successfull

I'm not sure what happened, but its passing locally now, and I didn't see anything wrong explaining why it would fail.  I've merged in, but had to rebase so if you wouldn't mind closing this PR.  Thanks for the contribution!
Can you update your commits to include the jira ticket? In addition, if you could remove the merge commit even better.  Remember `git pull --rebase`

Can you squash the commits?
Also please reference the JIRA ticket https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DELTASPIKE-1181
I will squash the commits. I just wanted to separate fixes for multiple issues - every commit fixes a single issue.

The commits are squashed now. I also fixed a compilation issue - the Java8 test project did not specify Java8 compilation target, so it took 1.6 from a parent POM.

I'm not able to add reference to DELTASPIKE-1181 - I changed the commit message in my local repo, but force push does not update the commit message.
Now the build is failing in Jenkins on some weird issue with mvn. The compilation error is gone though.
Thanks, just brought this in.

Thanks for the contrib, merged to master!

Hi Andrea,

Thanks for the contrib.  Couple of things I noticed.
- This output is observed when building locally:

```
asciidoctor: WARNING: index.adoc: line 4: section title out of sequence: expected level 1, got level 2
asciidoctor: WARNING: index.adoc: line 19: section title out of sequence: expected level 1, got level 2
asciidoctor: WARNING: index.adoc: line 30: section title out of sequence: expected level 1, got level 2
asciidoctor: WARNING: index.adoc: line 38: section title out of sequence: expected level 1, got level 2
asciidoctor: WARNING: index.adoc: line 48: section title out of sequence: expected level 1, got level 2
```
- The graphics don't render when I build locally.  When I change to the proper URI (remove images/), the logo is way too large.
- The layout is now much different.  Do you know if there's a way to maintain our existing layout?

Hi John,

To convert the index.html I run the following commands with pandoc (first converting to markdown and then in asciidoc):

```
pandoc -s -r html <index.html_url> -o index.text
pandoc -s -S index.text -t asciidoc -o index.adoc
```

I noticed there is a file deltaspike-markdown.html included in the index.html

```
http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/deltaspike/site/trunk/templates/deltaspike-markdown.html
```

We can follow the same procedure for it and then try to include it in the index.adoc with 

```
include::deltaspike-markdown.adoc[]
```

But the result is ugly.

I'll try to avoid the Warning, for the layout I don't know how we can do.
The warnings disappeared
Sorry, just getting back to this.  We're using maven and asciidoctorj for the rendering right now.  Never heard of pandoc.
Pandoc is a just a tool to convert from a format to another. Anyway now I don't see errors during the rendering, so I believe it can be merged and maybe think about the style next. Let me know :-)
Changes merged, however I had to rebase.  Please close this PR.
If this weren't our homepage, I would be OK with that.  However, the homepage is what people see first, so it being clean is IMHO pretty important.
What about rendering as a table? http://asciidoctor.org/docs/asciidoc-syntax-quick-reference/#tables

Sure. I'll try to use tables :-)

Thanks a lot!

hi @johnament , I have looked around git log of deltaspike to learn how to write the comment followed the deltaspike way. I'd like to close this PR and create a new PR again, ok?

squash the commit, please check it , thanks!

Here there are two questions need to discuss:
1, there is only one business logic layer: ArticleController, no bean layer, no service layer. Should I seperate ArticleController into ArticleBean and ArticleService ?

2, I put @ViewScoped onto ArticleController, because from article list page(list.xhtml), we can click "edit" link to go to add.xhtml to edit the slelected article, so we must merge the article when click the save button, that is why I use @ViewScoped. It seemed that, WindowScoped or ViewAccessScoped should also works. I don't know how to make it work when used @RequestScoped, any idea?

thanks!

Hi, sorry for the delay in looking at this.  The problem at this point is your PRs are in conflict with one another.  In one you're adding wildfly plugin 1.0.1 and the other 1.1.0.  Which is intended?
